clinical_study.brief_title: Ursodeoxycholic Acid Combined With Total Glucosides of Paeony in the Treatment of PBC With AIH Features 1
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized Controlled Open-label Clinical Trial of Ursodeoxycholic Acid Combined With Total Glucosides of Paeony in the Treatment of PBC With AIH Features 1

brief_summary.textblock: A randomized controlled open-label clinical trial of ursodeoxycholic acid combined with total glucosides of paeony in the treatment of PBC with AIH features 1

primary_outcome.description: The percentage of patients in biochemical remission, defined as normalization of serum ALT and IgG levels after 24 weeks of treatment, per treatment group.

secondary_outcome.description: Partial remission, defined as alanine aminotransferase (ALT) or aspartate aminotransferase (AST) serum levels >1x Upper Limit of Normal (ULN) and <2x ULN
Minimal response, defined as decrease of ALT or AST serum levels but still >2x ULN
defined as no improvement or increase of ALT or AST serum levels

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in the proportion of blood immune cells
secondary_outcome.description: percentage of T cells, DC, MDSC, Treg, Breg, plasma cells, NK, NKT
